New Records: Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli both scored fifties and made sure India reach a stiff total of 192/2 against Hong Kong.
Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav launched the Hong Kong spinners across all corners and remained unbeaten at 68 off 26 balls.
Virat Kohli got to his first international fifty since February and was unbeaten at 59 off 44.
Ravindra Jadeja got the wicket of Nizakat Khan with a rocket arm, rocket throw and the batter found himself short of crease.
Babar Hayat was caught at short third man by Avesh Khan for 41.
India beat Hong Kong by 40 runs to qualify for the Super Fours.
Pre-Game Insights: India will have to bat first after Hong Kong won the toss and opted to bowl in their opening game in this year’s Asia Cup.
Rohit Sharma made just one change to the side, bringing in Pant for Hardik which means DK keeps his place.
Post-Match Reflections: The difference in the end was SKY’s fifty—it made all the difference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India had to bat first and lost the wicket of Rohit Sharma early.
KL Rahul was also dismissed after a slow 36 off 39 balls.
Hong Kong started well as the young Indian pacers faltered.
The Indian spinners came into picture and Hong Kong chase lost steam.
Others: The Asia Cup 2022 match between India and Hong Kong will take place on August 31, Wednesday.
The Asia Cup 2022 match between India and Hong Kong will be played at the Dubai International Stadium.
The Asia Cup 2022 match between India and Hong Kong will begin at 7:30 pm IST.
